translation.en: Andrei Postolache: The first project consists of a minimum informatization of the City Hall activities so that the various departments, institutions and administrations are able to better cooperate.
translation.ro: Andrei Postolache: Primul proiect constă într-o minimă informatizare a activității primăriei astfel încât diferitele departamente, instituții și regii să colaboreze cât mai bine.

target: Andrei Postolache: Primul proiect constă într-o minimă informatizare a activității primăriei astfel încât diferitele departamente, instituții și regii să colaboreze cât mai bine.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Andrei Postolache: The first project consists of a minimum informatization of the City Hall activities so that the various departments, institutions and administrations are able to better cooperate.
resps: In this respect, it was considered that we need a software program that can be used by all the departments, and it must be a software program that can be used not only in our City Hall but also in all the local public administrations in our country. Therefore, we have designed a software program that can be used by all the local public administrations in Romania, a software program that is able to help the local public administrations in their day-to-day activities.

The second project is related to the construction of a database containing the city's cultural heritage, which will be accessible to the public on the Internet. The third project is related to the construction of a multimedia database containing the city's cultural heritage in the form of images, movies, and sounds, which will be accessible to the public on the Internet. The fourth project is related to the creation of a web portal for the City of Gheorgheni that will provide the public with information about current events, activities, and news of the city. The fifth project is related to the creation of a digital library that will contain a large number of books, newspapers, magazines, and other publications in electronic form, which will be accessible to the public on the Internet. The sixth project is related to the creation of an e-learning platform that will provide the public with access to courses, training materials, and other educational resources on the Internet. The seventh project is related to the creation of an e-commerce platform that will allow businesses and individuals to buy and sell products and services on the Internet. The eighth project is related to the creation of an e-government platform that will allow citizens to interact with the city's government and administrative services on the Internet.

This project will include the installation of a local network with internet connectivity and a server for storing data and exchanging documents. We are also planning to purchase software licenses and office equipment, especially for the accounting department. The second project is more ambitious. It aims to create a municipal database that will include information about all the inhabitants of the city. This will be done by creating a system of identification cards that will be distributed to all the citizens. This project is called the Municipal ID project. The third project is a project to create a municipal web page for the City Hall. This will be a web page where all the important information about the city will be posted, including information about the local administration, the departments and the institutions of the city, the economic activities that take place in the city, the educational and cultural institutions, the sport facilities, the health services, and so on. The web page will also include information about the history of the city, the traditions, the folklore, the festivals, and so on. We have already started to work on this project and we hope to finish it by the end of the year.

arguments: translate English to Romanian: ZDI: Today, a city's image is very important.
resps: The inhabitants of that city must be proud of their city, and the visitors must have a good impression of the place. The image of the city is a very complex concept, which includes aspects such as the level of safety, the architectural appearance, the cleanliness, and the behavior of its inhabitants. I will talk about the image of the city and how it can be improved.

A city's image is formed by its past, present and future. The past includes history, monuments and traditions. The present includes a city's economy, its infrastructure and its people. The future includes the city's plans and projects.

Weather it's for tourism or business, it's more and more important to have a good image. That's why we have a Web site where you can vote for the best city in Romania. For example, if you like a city, you can vote for it.
I work as a tour guide and I can tell you for sure that city image influences greatly the number of tourists that want to visit a city.

The European Commission has included Bucharest on the list of cities that could become smart cities. The problem is that we are not investing in the right places. translation.en: We do not want "volunteers" who were forced into buses and brought to us.
translation.ro: Noi nu vrem să avem "voluntari" aduși cu autobuzul.

target: Noi nu vrem să avem "voluntari" aduși cu autobuzul.

resps: We need helpers who come voluntarily and stay voluntarily.
bleu: Noi nu vrem să avem "voluntari" aduși cu autobuzul.

translation.en: That means we rely on people who really want to get involved and help, and we believe that there are enough people like this.
translation.ro: Asta înseamnă că ne bazăm pe oamenii care chiar vor să se implice și să ajute, iar noi credem că sunt destui oameni de acest fel.

target: Asta înseamnă că ne bazăm pe oamenii care chiar vor să se implice și să ajute, iar noi credem că sunt destui oameni de acest fel.

translation.en: Andrei Postolache has been working in the IT industry for nearly 15 years.
translation.ro: Andrei Postolache lucrează în industria IT de aproape 15 ani.

target: Andrei Postolache lucrează în industria IT de aproape 15 ani.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Andrei Postolache has been working in the IT industry for nearly 15 years.
resps: For the past three years he has been the CTO of UiPath, a fast-growing enterprise robotic process automation technology company. Headquartered in New York City, UiPath has over 1,100 employees and recently closed a $153 million series B funding round, bringing the total funding raised to $182.7 million. The company is valued at $1.1 billion, and its software is used by 700 enterprise clients, including NASA, Dentsu Aegis, General Electric, and Lufthansa.

His experience is primarily with Microsoft technologies (Server, Client, Cloud, Development) and he has published 9 books about Windows Server, SharePoint, and Azure. Andrei is an active member of the Windows Server User Group and has presented at numerous events and conferences throughout the world including Microsoft Ignite, TechEd, MVP Days, IT Camp, and SharePoint Saturday. He is also a Microsoft Certified Solution Master (MCSM), Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT), and a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) for Cloud and Datacenter Management since 2008. Andrei is also a Microsoft Regional Director (RD), which is the highest distinction given to an IT expert by Microsoft on a regional level, and a Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert.
bleu: Andrei Postolache lucrează în industria IT de aproape 15 ani.

translation.en: In July 2015 he founded Introspecials. Before this was a director of the Endava international concern for seven years (2008 to 2015), where he led a team of 300 people.
translation.ro: În iulie 2015 a înființat compania Introspecials, după ce, timp de șapte ani, a fost director în cadrul concernului internațional Endava (2008 - 2015), unde a coordonat o echipă de 300 de oameni.

target: În iulie 2015 a înființat compania Introspecials, după ce, timp de șapte ani, a fost director în cadrul concernului internațional Endava (2008 - 2015), unde a coordonat o echipă de 300 de oameni.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: In July 2015 he founded Introspecials. Before this was a director of the Endava international concern for seven years (2008 to 2015), where he led a team of 300 people.
resps: In 2015, Enea was appointed as an advisor in the Government of Romania, with the responsibility of leading the Digital Agenda. In this role, he had the opportunity to set up the first parts of the Romanian Innovation Center in New York and to start the process of approving the new Romanian digital strategy.
In 2014 the team was awarded the Best Delivery unit prize.
bleu: În iulie 2015 a înființat compania Introspecials, după ce, timp de șapte ani, a fost director în cadrul concernului internațional Endava (2008 - 2015), unde a coordonat o echipă de 300 de oameni.

translation.en: The Tractor "Scrappage" Program, a failure

arguments: translate English to Romanian: The Tractor "Scrappage" Program, a failure

for the Romanian economy?

Programul Rabla pentru tractoare s-a dovedit un eșec

translation.en: The General Manager of SC IRUM SA Reghin, Mircea Oltean, said that the program to stimulate the renewal of the national park of tractors and agricultural machinery, initiated in 2011, also called the Tractor Scrappage Program, was a failure due to bureaucracy.
translation.ro: Directorul general al SC IRUM SA Reghin, Mircea Oltean, a declarat că Programul de stimulare a înnoirii parcului național de tractoare și mașini agricole, inițiat în 2011, denumit și Rabla pentru tractoare, a fost un eșec din cauza birocrației.

target: Directorul general al SC IRUM SA Reghin, Mircea Oltean, a declarat că Programul de stimulare a înnoirii parcului național de tractoare și mașini agricole, inițiat în 2011, denumit și Rabla pentru tractoare, a fost un eșec din cauza birocrației.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The General Manager of SC IRUM SA Reghin, Mircea Oltean, said that the program to stimulate the renewal of the national park of tractors and agricultural machinery, initiated in 2011, also called the Tractor Scrappage Program, was a failure due to bureaucracy.
resps: The program was discontinued.
bleu: Directorul general al SC IRUM SA Reghin, Mircea Oltean, a declarat că Programul de stimulare a înnoirii parcului național de tractoare și mașini agricole, inițiat în 2011, denumit și Rabla pentru tractoare, a fost un eșec din cauza birocrației.

translation.en: Regarding the Scrappage program, there were some attempts in recent years, but it turned out to be a failure, because the documentation was very laborious and complicated for an ordinary farmer and the approvals took too long, so people gave up.
translation.ro: Legat de Programul Rabla, au fost niște încercări în ultimii ani, dar s-a dovedit că a fost un eșec, pentru că documentația era foarte laborioasă și complicată pentru un agricultor de rând, iar aprobările erau mult prea de durată și atunci lumea a renunțat.

target: Legat de Programul Rabla, au fost niște încercări în ultimii ani, dar s-a dovedit că a fost un eșec, pentru că documentația era foarte laborioasă și complicată pentru un agricultor de rând, iar aprobările erau mult prea de durată și atunci lumea a renunțat.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Regarding the Scrappage program, there were some attempts in recent years, but it turned out to be a failure, because the documentation was very laborious and complicated for an ordinary farmer and the approvals took too long, so people gave up.
bleu: Legat de Programul Rabla, au fost niște încercări în ultimii ani, dar s-a dovedit că a fost un eșec, pentru că documentația era foarte laborioasă și complicată pentru un agricultor de rând, iar aprobările erau mult prea de durată și atunci lumea a renunțat.

translation.en: "The need of tractors for the Romanian agriculture would be 300,000 pieces," said Mircea Oltean.
translation.ro: "Necesarul de tractoare pentru agricultura românească ar fi de 300.000 de bucăți", a declarat Mircea Oltean.

target: "Necesarul de tractoare pentru agricultura românească ar fi de 300.000 de bucăți", a declarat Mircea Oltean.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: "The need of tractors for the Romanian agriculture would be 300,000 pieces," said Mircea Oltean.
resps: "Currently, the Romanian agriculture uses approximately 120,000 tractors. Realistically, we could reach this number in 3-4 years. The agricultural mechanization is critical for the development of agriculture, and we hope that we will have good news for the farmers in 2015."

"Necesarul de tractoare pentru agricultura românească ar fi de 300.000 de bucăți", a declarat Mircea Oltean.

translation.en: According to him, IRUM Reghin is the only company that produces several hundred tractors annually, being the largest company of this kind in Romania, and that greater competition is exercised by foreign companies, who know the Romanian market needs.
translation.ro: Potrivit acestuia, IRUM Reghin este singura companie care produce câteva sute de tractoare anual, fiind cea mai mare din România, și că marea concurență este exercitată de firme din străinătate, care cunosc nevoile pieței românești.

target: Potrivit acestuia, IRUM Reghin este singura companie care produce câteva sute de tractoare anual, fiind cea mai mare din România, și că marea concurență este exercitată de firme din străinătate, care cunosc nevoile pieței românești.

translation.en: It is a huge competition with those coming from abroad, all global manufacturers have set their sights on Romania, I know what I am saying, and they have special policies.
translation.ro: Este o concurență foarte mare cu cei care vin de afară, toți producătorii mondiali au pus ochii pe România, știu aceste lucruri pe care vi le-am spus, și au politici speciale.

target: Este o concurență foarte mare cu cei care vin de afară, toți producătorii mondiali au pus ochii pe România, știu aceste lucruri pe care vi le-am spus, și au politici speciale.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: It is a huge competition with those coming from abroad, all global manufacturers have set their sights on Romania, I know what I am saying, and they have special policies.
resps: I would not know who they are all, but I know that the Chinese are very aggressive and the Koreans are coming in even more aggressive, the Japanese are coming in, and the Indians are coming in, and the Americans are coming in, and the Germans are coming in, and the French are coming in, and the Italians are coming in, and the Spanish are coming in, and the ones from the Arab countries are coming in, and those from the former Soviet Union are coming in, and the Russians, the Ukrainians, and the Belarusians are coming in, and the Israelis are coming in, and the Iranians are coming in.
bleu: Este o concurență foarte mare cu cei care vin de afară, toți producătorii mondiali au pus ochii pe România, știu aceste lucruri pe care vi le-am spus, și au politici speciale.

translation.en: "There is huge cram at all the fairs, all the manufacturers come with all sorts of variations" said Mircea Oltean, who said that IRUM Reghin manufactures around 500 agricultural tractors and forestry tractors a year.
translation.ro: "La toate târgurile e aglomerație mare, toți producătorii expun, vin cu totul felul de variante", a subliniat Mircea Oltean, care a precizat că IRUM Reghin produce anual în jur de 500 de tractoare agricole și tractoare forestiere.

translation.en: Through the Tractor Scrappage Program, initiated in 2011, those who own old tractors or other self-propelled means of transport, such as harvesters, could hand them over and receive in exchange a voucher for 17,000 lei.
translation.ro: Prin programul Rabla pentru tractoare, inițiat în 2011, cei care dețineau tractoare vechi sau alte mijloace auto-propulsate, cum sunt combinele, puteau săle predea și primeau în schimb un tichet valoric de 17.000 de lei.

target: Prin programul Rabla pentru tractoare, inițiat în 2011, cei care dețineau tractoare vechi sau alte mijloace auto-propulsate, cum sunt combinele, puteau săle predea și primeau în schimb un tichet valoric de 17.000 de lei.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Through the Tractor Scrappage Program, initiated in 2011, those who own old tractors or other self-propelled means of transport, such as harvesters, could hand them over and receive in exchange a voucher for 17,000 lei.
resps: Those who took advantage of the program could use the voucher for the purchase of a new tractor or other self-propelled agricultural machinery. The program, which ended in 2012, had a twofold aim: to eliminate old and obsolete agricultural machinery, thus contributing to the modernization of agriculture, and to stimulate sales of new agricultural machinery.
The value of the voucher was raised by 3,000 lei for those who trade in three or more machines.

translation.en: That is what yesterday Jeremy Corbyn sang in the London pub Sanctuary House.

resps: I have no idea whether this is true or not. Since the results of the British elections have been announced, the international media has been full of reports about Corbyn and his Labour Party, their unexpectedly good electoral results and the way in which the party apparently managed to attract many young electors. But in Romania the media is silent on this matter, and so are my colleagues in the Anglistic Department of the University of Bucharest.

translation.en: Readers who are not familiar with the melody of this unofficial British and international leftist anthem (The Red Flag) can search the Internet they might have a surprise.
translation.ro: Cititorii care nu știu linia melodică a acestui imn neoficial al stângii britanice și internaționale (Steagul roșu/ The Red Flag) o pot căuta pe internet și n-ar fi exclus să aibă parte de o surpriză.

target: Cititorii care nu știu linia melodică a acestui imn neoficial al stângii britanice și internaționale (Steagul roșu/ The Red Flag) o pot căuta pe internet și n-ar fi exclus să aibă parte de o surpriză.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Readers who are not familiar with the melody of this unofficial British and international leftist anthem (The Red Flag) can search the Internet they might have a surprise.
resps: It is a beautiful melody, with a really sad text and a very powerful message. It is a song born from the pain of the poor, the weak, the oppressed. It is the song of the workers who have nothing to lose but their chains. I am writing this introduction in English, because I know that those who will read it will be able to understand it, as the song I'm talking about was translated into many languages. But there is one language in which The Red Flag was not translated, and that's Romanian. And it is for this reason that I decided to translate it, moreover I have a long history of translating all kinds of texts from English to Romanian. The original version of this song was written in 1889 by Jim Connell, a member of the Social Democratic Federation. The text of this song is a kind of summary of all the ideas of socialism. It is a song of the oppressed, a song of the poor, a song of the workers, a song of the exploited. In the four verses of this song are mentioned the names of the most important figures of the socialist movement, such as Marx, Engels, Liebknecht, and L
The beginning of the stanza is an excerpt from the first verse of the Internationale, which is the international socialist anthem.
I am happy to hear that the Romanian left has a song. In the past, the songs of the Romanian left were prohibited by the communist government.

translation.en: The direct voting system was not invented by the Labour Party among the Western left for their leader.
translation.ro: Nu laburiștii britanici au inventat sistemul votului direct pentru liderul partidului, în rândul stângii occidentale.

target: Nu laburiștii britanici au inventat sistemul votului direct pentru liderul partidului, în rândul stângii occidentale.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The direct voting system was not invented by the Labour Party among the Western left for their leader.
resps: It has a much older tradition, dating back to the first third of the 19th century, when the Chartists in the United Kingdom demanded the right to vote for the British working class. The Chartists were the first to present a draft constitution, including the direct popular vote, and to collect signatures from the British public in order to pass it on to the Parliament in London.
filtered_resps: It has a much older tradition, dating back to the first third of the 19th century, when the Chartists in the United Kingdom demanded the right to vote for the British working class. The Chartists were the first to present a draft constitution, including the direct popular vote, and to collect signatures from the British public in order to pass it on to the Parliament in London.
bleu: It has a much older tradition, dating back to the first third of the 19th century, when the Chartists in the United Kingdom demanded the right to vote for the British working class. The Chartists were the first to present a draft constitution, including the direct popular vote, and to collect signatures from the British public in order to pass it on to the Parliament in London.
Nu laburiștii britanici au inventat sistemul votului direct pentru liderul partidului, în rândul stângii occidentale.

translation.en: French socialists have been practicing a more complicated system based on motion for several years. This system allows all members and supporters to express themselves; In addition, they held a preliminary competition for the 2012 nomination of the presidential candidate.
translation.ro: Socialiștii francezi practică de câțiva ani un sistem mai complicat, bazat pe moțiuni, care permite exprimarea tuturor membrilor și simpatizanților; în plus, ei au organizat o competiție preliminară pentru desemnarea candidatului la prezidențiale din 2012.

target: Socialiștii francezi practică de câțiva ani un sistem mai complicat, bazat pe moțiuni, care permite exprimarea tuturor membrilor și simpatizanților; în plus, ei au organizat o competiție preliminară pentru desemnarea candidatului la prezidențiale din 2012.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: French socialists have been practicing a more complicated system based on motion for several years. This system allows all members and supporters to express themselves; In addition, they held a preliminary competition for the 2012 nomination of the presidential candidate.
resps: The socialists are organizing a vote of party members and sympathizers to choose their candidate. This primary, which will take place in October, will be open to all citizens registered on the electoral lists. The socialists want to use this exercise to mobilize voters and to show that the left is capable of organizing an unprecedented democratic process in France.

In this competition, the Socialist Party, the Green Party and the Democratic Union of Hungarians in Romania were involved. The winner of this competition, Mircea Geoana, ran in the preliminary round of the presidential elections. The Socialist Party, the Green Party and the Democratic Union of Hungarians in Romania are part of the Socialist International.

This primary, which will take place in October, will be open to all citizens registered on the electoral lists. The socialists want to use this exercise to mobilize voters and to show that the left is capable of organizing an unprecedented democratic process in France.
bleu: The socialists are organizing a vote of party members and sympathizers to choose their candidate. This primary, which will take place in October, will be open to all citizens registered on the electoral lists. The socialists want to use this exercise to mobilize voters and to show that the left is capable of organizing an unprecedented democratic process in France.

translation.en: This is of course also a political system matter, the personalization of power is more pronounced in the UK than on the other side of the English Channel.
translation.ro: Este, desigur, și o chestiune de sistem politic, personalizarea puterii fiind mai pronunțată în Marea Britanie decât de cealaltă parte a Canalului Mânecii.

target: Este, desigur, și o chestiune de sistem politic, personalizarea puterii fiind mai pronunțată în Marea Britanie decât de cealaltă parte a Canalului Mânecii.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: This is of course also a political system matter, the personalization of power is more pronounced in the UK than on the other side of the English Channel.
resps: As for the differences between the UK and Ireland, the Irish Constitution, for example, is much more detailed than the British Constitution. This makes the Irish Constitution a more rigid system compared to the Westminster system.

For example, in the UK the Prime Minister is the head of government and also the leader of the party that has the majority in the Parliament, which is not the case for the President of the French Republic (who is the head of state). The French President can't be the leader of a party and also has less power than the UK PM.
bleu: Este, desigur, și o chestiune de sistem politic, personalizarea puterii fiind mai pronunțată în Marea Britanie decât de cealaltă parte a Canalului Mânecii.

translation.en: In addition, voter turnout was high in all three "circles": the actual members, union members and other organizations affiliated to the party, and finally, the group of sympathizers (who received the ballot paper after a brief registration procedure).
translation.ro: În plus, participarea la vot a fost mare în toate cele trei "cercuri": membrii propriu-ziși, membrii sindicatelor și ai altor organizații afiliate partidului și, în fine, grupul simpatizanților (care au primit buletinul de vot după o sumară procedură de înregistrare).

target: În plus, participarea la vot a fost mare în toate cele trei "cercuri": membrii propriu-ziși, membrii sindicatelor și ai altor organizații afiliate partidului și, în fine, grupul simpatizanților (care au primit buletinul de vot după o sumară procedură de înregistrare).
arguments: translate English to Romanian: In addition, voter turnout was high in all three "circles": the actual members, union members and other organizations affiliated to the party, and finally, the group of sympathizers (who received the ballot paper after a brief registration procedure).

translation.en: The latter group gives us interesting information about the perceptions of the left segments of the British society, especially those made of young or middle-aged educated individuals, interested in the political phenomenon.

translation.en: If we really want to identify an "anti-system" vocation, it is primarily reflected by the rejection of the centrist line, New Labour (for many, a disguised form of the much abused Thatcherism).
translation.ro: Dacă ținem să identificăm o vocație "antisistem", ea se reflectă în primul rând prin respingerea liniei centriste, New Labour (pentru mulți, doar o formă disimulată a mult-hulitului thatcherism).

target: Dacă ținem să identificăm o vocație "antisistem", ea se reflectă în primul rând prin respingerea liniei centriste, New Labour (pentru mulți, doar o formă disimulată a mult-hulitului thatcherism).
arguments: translate English to Romanian: If we really want to identify an "anti-system" vocation, it is primarily reflected by the rejection of the centrist line, New Labour (for many, a disguised form of the much abused Thatcherism).
resps: The New Left is the only political force that wants to re-think the political, social and economic structures in Romania in accordance with the 21st century.

But at the same time, the rejection of the centrist line is not enough to define the "anti-system" character; rather, it is the result of the dissatisfaction and the rejection of a broken system which has failed to meet the expectations of the people.

It is also reflected by the fact that many Romanian non-governmental organisations (either on the left or on the right) are suspicious of the European integration process, while others are openly nationalist. The Romanian left is rather weak and is divided into three main groups: the Social Democratic Party (PSD), the National Union for the Progress of Romania (UNPR) and the Social Liberal Union (USL).
This is not the position of the PSD, which openly embraces the centre-left option and defines its political identity in opposition to the right.
filtered_resps: The New Left is the only political force that wants to re-think the political, social and economic structures in Romania in accordance with the 21st century.
bleu: The New Left is the only political force that wants to re-think the political, social and economic structures in Romania in accordance with the 21st century.

translation.en: The second component would be the repudiation of leaders who are considered guilty of the two successive electoral failures, one of the arguments being that did they were not leftist enough, not being firmly delineated from the Tony Blair era.
translation.ro: Cea de-a doua componentă ar fi repudierea liderilor considerați vinovați de cele două eșecuri electorale succesive, unul dintre argumente fiind acela că nu au mers suficient către stânga, că nu s-au delimitat ferm de epoca Tony Blair.

target: Cea de-a doua componentă ar fi repudierea liderilor considerați vinovați de cele două eșecuri electorale succesive, unul dintre argumente fiind acela că nu au mers suficient către stânga, că nu s-au delimitat ferm de epoca Tony Blair.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The second component would be the repudiation of leaders who are considered guilty of the two successive electoral failures, one of the arguments being that did they were not leftist enough, not being firmly delineated from the Tony Blair era.
resps: There is a certain degree of truth in this repudiation, but the main problem was the lack of a coherent project, of a viable political offer.

The third component refers to the fact that the left-wing parties should force each other to create a united political front, which ensures that the vote of the left does not split and which should be able to compete with the right-wing parties.

The third component would be the questioning of the current political and economic system, the demand for a radical system change. The project would need to have a strong emotional appeal, promising to undo the injustices of the past and provide a better life for all people and the underprivileged. The rhetoric would be vigorous, but also vague, in order to inspire a broad coalition of participants, from the far left to the center left, all of which would be brought together by the vision of a better, fairer society. The project would have the support of the Romanian leftist intellectuals, and would be likely to secure a majority in Parliament, given the current fragmentation of the center right, the disillusionment of the electorate with the current politicians, and the attraction of a new and radical proposal.
bleu: Cea de-a doua componentă ar fi repudierea liderilor considerați vinovați de cele două eșecuri electorale succesive, unul dintre argumente fiind acela că nu au mers suficient către stânga, că nu s-au delimitat ferm de epoca Tony Blair.

translation.en: The second reference frame - in my opinion, which is more suggestive - is offered by the recent referendum for independence in Scotland.
translation.ro: Cel de-al doilea reper - după mine, și mai sugestiv - este oferit de recentul referendum pentru independența Scoției.

target: Cel de-al doilea reper - după mine, și mai sugestiv - este oferit de recentul referendum pentru independența Scoției.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The second reference frame - in my opinion, which is more suggestive - is offered by the recent referendum for independence in Scotland.
resps: British people seem to have accepted the idea that they were no longer the same people as those living in Scotland. Although Scotland and the UK have preserved their formal unity, they have adopted two different referendum frames, and the central government has not been able to impose its own (or at least not yet). Based on this analogy, I think that the current situation of Ukraine is closer to that of Scotland than to that of the Baltic states, which have adopted unambiguously the European frame.

The outcome of this referendum, according to the Romanian media, has two main causes. First of all, the majority of the Scottish population was convinced that an independent Scotland would be more prosperous, with a more efficient economy and with a more equitable distribution of wealth. Second, the Scottish population has not identified itself with the British state and, in particular, with the political elites that have led the United Kingdom in the last decade, perceived as insensitive and unresponsive to many of the Scottish population’s needs. If we relate these causes to the situation in Romania, we could identify a similar dissatisfaction with the Romanian state, both in terms of economic performance and social justice, as well as in terms of the legitimacy of the political elites.

The Romanians have predominantly voted in favor of Scotland's independence from Great Britain, and the arguments put forward by English nationalists in favor of the union have been received with skepticism. The reason is our history, which has been marked by a multitude of foreign domination and the forced unionism. The Union between Romania and Moldova is not the same thing, but the scenario of a forced unionism is obvious and I think that Romania would be better off without it.

Let's think of the many similarities between the two cases. Both Scotland and Transylvania have had a prior status of independence, which was followed by a period of domination and integration into a larger state. In Scotland, the integration took place in a peaceful way, but in Transylvania, the process was accompanied by conflict, conquest, and assimilation. Transylvania was integrated into Romania by the Treaty of Trianon, and a part of the Transylvanian population became a minority in Romania. The integration of Scotland in the United Kingdom happened in a more subtle way, through a process of union, by means of which the Scottish Parliament lost its sovereign rights. However, the Scottish people have kept their cultural identity and their own institutions, which is why the issue of independence has arisen in recent years. I would like to emphasize that, in both cases, it is not a question of nationalism, but of self-determination of peoples. The referendum in Scotland and the recent debates on the status of Transylvania are not impregnated with nationalism or chauvinism, but are aimed at the re-evaluation of the status of territories that were once independent.

arguments: translate English to Romanian: With the vocation of an outsider, Jeremy Corbyn has more chances of success than Ed Miliband, the Labour Party "aristocrat".
resps: The Labour Party is a social-democratic political party in the United Kingdom. It emerged in 1900 out of the trade union movement and socialist parties of the United Kingdom. It is the largest party in the UK's House of Commons and the second-largest in the Scottish Parliament, having won the largest number of Scottish seats at the 2011 election. The Labour Party leader is Jeremy Corbyn, who has been leader since 12 September 2015, when he was elected in a landslide victory in the leadership election. Corbyn is a democratic socialist and a member of the Socialist Campaign Group. He was first elected to Parliament in 1983 as the Member of Parliament for Islington North. Corbyn was born in Chippenham, Wiltshire, and grew up in Shropshire. He was educated at the Adams' Grammar School in Newport, Shropshire, and at North London Polytechnic, where he studied trade union studies and industrial relations. Corbyn has been a vegetarian since the age of 20. He has been married three times and has three sons. Corbyn has been a member of the Labour Party

translation.en: I believe the comparison with Scotland tells us more than the one with the anti-system left in Europe's southern periphery.
translation.ro: Comparația cu Scoția ne spune mai multe, cred, decât cea cu stânga antisistem din periferia sudică a Europei.

target: Comparația cu Scoția ne spune mai multe, cred, decât cea cu stânga antisistem din periferia sudică a Europei.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: I believe the comparison with Scotland tells us more than the one with the anti-system left in Europe's southern periphery.
resps: First, the comparison with Scotland is useful because it highlights the importance of regionalism in Romania's political landscape. Second, it helps explain the development of a Romanian regionalism that is different from the anti-system left in southern Europe. Regionalism in Romania is largely of a civic nature, based on the belief in the existence of cultural and historical differences between regions, and not on a pre-modern ethnic identity. This is why the regionalist party that exists in Romania, the Democratic Union of Hungarians in Romania (UDMR), does not promote a separatist agenda. Instead, it seeks to ensure that Romanian Hungarians have access to their own specific cultural and linguistic identity as part of the Romanian state. In addition, the Scottish example shows that regionalism in Romania does not necessarily have to be anti-systemic. The Scottish National Party (SNP), like the UDMR, is a regionalist party that is part of the political system. While the SNP is more radical than the UDMR, it is not anti-systemic, and it has been able to negotiate the particularities of Scottish identity within the UK's political system.

Both Romania and Scotland are regions with strong identities (both at the elite and at the mass level) and both are peripheral members of their respective states. Scotland, however, has regional autonomy and is able to make laws, while Romania is a unitary state, not even a federal one. The comparison with Scotland seems to be illustrative of what Romania could become, but only if there is a major shift in the ideological landscape and a change in the balance of power between centripetal and centrifugal forces within Romania. As a consequence of this shift, the country could become a federal state, with the regions (or, more precisely, the historical provinces) having a major role in deciding upon the laws and policies that are implemented by the central government. The political environment in Romania is changing, but it is unlikely that the country will become a federal state in the near future. Nevertheless, the 2020 presidential election demonstrated that the Romanians may be ready for such a change.
bleu: Comparația cu Scoția ne spune mai multe, cred, decât cea cu stânga antisistem din periferia sudică a Europei.

Marin (the two categorizations - "rebel" and "jihadist" - could have made me cautious from the start).
resps: The search in English led me to the original article. The search in Romanian led to a Romanian article by the same author, published on the same day, which contains a different story. I will not insist on the important detail that is missing in the Romanian article - the name of the Syrian commander, which is mentioned in the English article (Laith Al-Saleh) - because I think that the name of the Syrian commander is not important. I will not insist on the fact that, while the English article says that the Syrian commander became a "jihadist", the Romanian article says that the Syrian commander was hosting "jihadist" meetings (in fact, the English article also says that the Syrian commander hosted "jihadist" meetings, but it adds that he became a "jihadist"). I will insist only on one detail, namely, the date of the events. In the English article, the story of the Syrian commander is placed in 2013, the year when the commander left the Free Syrian Army and joined the Islamic Front. In the Romanian article, the story of the Syrian commander is placed in 2012, the year when the commander was

He is not just a "jihadist", but also the founder of "Jaish al-Tawhid" (Arabic for: Army of Monotheism), one of the most powerful militias in Aleppo, a member of the Islamic Front (the union between several militias, founded in November 2013) and at the same time, from the end of 2014, also a commander of the Syrian Revolutionary Front (SRF), a group of moderate Islamist militias, which, as far as I know, received support from the United States.

My searches did not yield much: neither in English nor in Romanian. At first glance, this seems to be the same person, but who are the "moderate rebels" he commands? I could not find any information about this either on the internet.
bleu: În timp ce am scris articolul mi-a trecut prin cap să verific pe net povestea fostului luptător și "comandant rebel sirian Laith Al-Saleh" devenit în partea a doua a spațiului dedicat de V. translation.en: The oldest information I could find was a story by the Associated Press (Syrian rebel leader seeks Europe) signed by Nicholas Baphitis and Dalton Bennett of 17 August 2015, about a man on the island of Kos in Greece, where he was noticed among hundreds, maybe thousands of refugees, who was trying to bring order to the chaos of the crowd.
translation.ro: Cea mai veche am găsit-o într-un material al Associated Press (Syrian rebel leader seeks Europe - Lider rebel sirian caută Europa) semnat de Nicholas Baphitis și Dalton Bennett din 17 august 2015 de pe insula Kos din Grecia, unde l-au remarcat, printre sutele, poate miile de refugiați, pe un bărbat care încerca să facă ordine în haosul mulțimii.

target: Cea mai veche am găsit-o într-un material al Associated Press (Syrian rebel leader seeks Europe - Lider rebel sirian caută Europa) semnat de Nicholas Baphitis și Dalton Bennett din 17 august 2015 de pe insula Kos din Grecia, unde l-au remarcat, printre sutele, poate miile de refugiați, pe un bărbat care încerca să facă ordine în haosul mulțimii.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The oldest information I could find was a story by the Associated Press (Syrian rebel leader seeks Europe) signed by Nicholas Baphitis and Dalton Bennett of 17 August 2015, about a man on the island of Kos in Greece, where he was noticed among hundreds, maybe thousands of refugees, who was trying to bring order to the chaos of the crowd.
resps: He was, the article said, "the leader of the Free Syrian Army, the main rebel force fighting the Assad regime." A few days later, on August 21, the article was published in a Romanian newspaper, _Romania libera_ (Free Romania), under the title "The leader of the Syrian rebels wants to go to Europe," the first sentence of which read: "The leader of the Free Syrian Army, the main rebel force fighting the Assad regime, was seen on the island of Kos, Greece, where he tried to bring order to the crowd of hundreds, maybe thousands of refugees" (Baphitis and Bennett 2015).
He was wearing a T-shirt with the words: "I am Abdul Basit Sarout, a rebel leader from Homs, Syria."

He was also looking for a place to have his mobile phone charged. He was described as a man in his fifties, with a bad back, and wearing a Saudi abaya. He told the journalists that he was a former general in the Syrian army, and that he had left the army before the war. He said that he was now a member of the Free Syrian Army. He told the journalists that he was looking for asylum in Europe, and that his family had already left Syria. He said that he was staying in Syria to fight the Islamic State. He also said that he was looking for a way to get to Holland.
bleu: Cea mai veche am găsit-o într-un material al Associated Press (Syrian rebel leader seeks Europe - Lider rebel sirian caută Europa) semnat de Nicholas Baphitis și Dalton Bennett din 17 august 2015 de pe insula Kos din Grecia, unde l-au remarcat, printre sutele, poate miile de refugiați, pe un bărbat care încerca să facă ordine în haosul mulțimii.

translation.en: The man was the Syrian Laith Al Saleh from Alep. He "is used to being in control", since he "led a unit of 700 rebels in the civil war in Syria".
translation.ro: Bărbatul era stucatorul sirian Laith Al Saleh din Alep care "e obișnuit să fie la comandă", de vreme ce "a condus o unitate de 700 de rebeli în războiul civil din Siria".

target: Bărbatul era stucatorul sirian Laith Al Saleh din Alep care "e obișnuit să fie la comandă", de vreme ce "a condus o unitate de 700 de rebeli în războiul civil din Siria".
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The man was the Syrian Laith Al Saleh from Alep. He "is used to being in control", since he "led a unit of 700 rebels in the civil war in Syria".
resps: He "is also a survivalist who has spent weeks in caves and forests". But now he is "a refugee in a camp in Greece" after he "fled the war in Syria with his family".

I am translating it like this: Bărbatul, originar din Siria, Laith Al Saleh din Alep "era obișnuit să aibă controlul", deoarece "a condus o unitate de 700 de rebeli în războiul civil sirian". Can you tell me if it's correct? Thank you in advance!
bleu: Bărbatul era stucatorul sirian Laith Al Saleh din Alep care "e obișnuit să fie la comandă", de vreme ce "a condus o unitate de 700 de rebeli în războiul civil din Siria".

translation.en: I also found out that Al Saleh, aged 30, had "a house, a wife and a normal life before the fighting began. The war ended over 250,000 lives and left one third of Syria's population homeless".
translation.ro: Mai aflăm că Al Saleh, în vârstă de 30 de ani, avusese "o casă, o soție și o viață normală înainte să înceapă lupta care a costat peste 250.000 de vieți și a pus pe drumuri o treime din populația Siriei".

target: Mai aflăm că Al Saleh, în vârstă de 30 de ani, avusese "o casă, o soție și o viață normală înainte să înceapă lupta care a costat peste 250.000 de vieți și a pus pe drumuri o treime din populația Siriei".
arguments: translate English to Romanian: I also found out that Al Saleh, aged 30, had "a house, a wife and a normal life before the fighting began. The war ended over 250,000 lives and left one third of Syria's population homeless".
resps: The English sentences seem to be the original ones.
I have no idea why this is so interesting to me.
filtered_resps: The English sentences seem to be the original ones.
bleu: The English sentences seem to be the original ones.

Mai aflăm că Al Saleh, în vârstă de 30 de ani, avusese "o casă, o soție și o viață normală înainte să înceapă lupta care a costat peste 250.000 de vieți și a pus pe drumuri o treime din populația Siriei".

translation.en: In the interview given to the Associated Press correspondents, Al Saleh says that "everyone wants to leave Syria".
translation.ro: În interviul dat corespondenților de la Associated Press, Al Saleh povestește că "toată lumea vrea să plece din Siria".

target: În interviul dat corespondenților de la Associated Press, Al Saleh povestește că "toată lumea vrea să plece din Siria".

În interviul dat corespondenților de la Associated Press, Al Saleh povestește că "toată lumea vrea să plece din Siria".

translation.en: My city is the most dangerous city in the world.
translation.ro: Orașul meu e cea mai periculoasă urbe din lume.

target: Orașul meu e cea mai periculoasă urbe din lume.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: My city is the most dangerous city in the world.

translation.en: About 70% of the city is in ruins.
translation.ro: Cam 70% din oraș e distrus.

target: Cam 70% din oraș e distrus.

translation.en: In Syria, I am wanted by Al Qaeda, Daesh (an extremist group of the Islamic State), the government - I have fought against them all.
translation.ro: În Siria, Al Qaeda mă vrea, Daesh (o grupare extremistă a Statului Islamic) mă vrea, guvernul mă vrea - am luptat împotriva tuturor.

target: În Siria, Al Qaeda mă vrea, Daesh (o grupare extremistă a Statului Islamic) mă vrea, guvernul mă vrea - am luptat împotriva tuturor.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: In Syria, I am wanted by Al Qaeda, Daesh (an extremist group of the Islamic State), the government - I have fought against them all.
resps: I am a worldwide-wanted man. I am an Islamist, not a terrorist, and I have suffered in my country. I am a refugee and I want to ask for asylum in Romania. I have a wife and four children, but they are not here with me, unfortunately. I am alone.

This is my story - I was part of Al Qaeda and Daesh (an extremist group of the Islamic State). I'm telling the whole story because I was one of them. I am wanted by Al Qaeda, the Islamic State, and the Syrian Government. This is my story.
bleu: În Siria, Al Qaeda mă vrea, Daesh (o grupare extremistă a Statului Islamic) mă vrea, guvernul mă vrea - am luptat împotriva tuturor.

translation.en: Beyond the fact that he was kicked out of a supermarket on the island, it seems Kos offered him "an even more sinister encounter - a man in which he recognized a Syrian enemy": "Two days ago, I saw a sniper from the government forces."
translation.ro: Dincolo de faptul că a fost dat afară dintr-un supermarket de pe insulă, Kos i-ar fi oferit "o întâlnire și mai sinistră - cu un bărbat în care a recunoscut un inamic sirian": "Acum două zile, am văzut un lunetist din forțele guvernamentale".

target: Dincolo de faptul că a fost dat afară dintr-un supermarket de pe insulă, Kos i-ar fi oferit "o întâlnire și mai sinistră - cu un bărbat în care a recunoscut un inamic sirian": "Acum două zile, am văzut un lunetist din forțele guvernamentale".
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Beyond the fact that he was kicked out of a supermarket on the island, it seems Kos offered him "an even more sinister encounter - a man in which he recognized a Syrian enemy": "Two days ago, I saw a sniper from the government forces."
resps: The man was called Abu Omar. "He was one of the worst snipers in the Syrian army. He killed many people in my city of Homs. He was killing civilians and had no mercy. I recognized him on an island in Greece, while I was looking for him for more than a year."
He was carrying a radio. The two men looked at each other and fled.
bleu: Dincolo de faptul că a fost dat afară dintr-un supermarket de pe insulă, Kos i-ar fi oferit "o întâlnire și mai sinistră - cu un bărbat în care a recunoscut un inamic sirian": "Acum două zile, am văzut un lunetist din forțele guvernamentale".

translation.en: I did not talk to him, but I'm still very upset.
translation.ro: N-am vorbit cu el, dar tot sunt foarte supărat.

target: N-am vorbit cu el, dar tot sunt foarte supărat.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: I did not talk to him, but I'm still very upset.
bleu: N-am vorbit cu el, dar tot sunt foarte supărat.

translation.en: The article also tells us that Laith (meaning lion in Arabic) was indeed on his way to Holland, to one of his cousins - a former senior officer in the Syrian army who also became a rebel and reached the West after being seriously injured - hoping to obtain asylum and eventually bring his family - his wife and a three year old boy (almost as old as the civil war in Syria, which broke out in March 2011).
translation.ro: Din material mai aflăm că Laith (care-nseamnă leu în arabă) era, într-adevăr, în drum spre Olanda, unde are un văr - fost ofițer superior în armata siriană și devenit apoi și el rebel și ajuns în Occident după ce a fost grav rănit - sperând să obțină azil și să-și poată aduce apoi și familia - soția și un băiețel de trei ani (aproape de-o vârstă cu războiul civil din Siria, care a izbucnit în martie 2011).

target: Din material mai aflăm că Laith (care-nseamnă leu în arabă) era, într-adevăr, în drum spre Olanda, unde are un văr - fost ofițer superior în armata siriană și devenit apoi și el rebel și ajuns în Occident după ce a fost grav rănit - sperând să obțină azil și să-și poată aduce apoi și familia - soția și un băiețel de trei ani (aproape de-o vârstă cu războiul civil din Siria, care a izbucnit în martie 2011).
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The article also tells us that Laith (meaning lion in Arabic) was indeed on his way to Holland, to one of his cousins - a former senior officer in the Syrian army who also became a rebel and reached the West after being seriously injured - hoping to obtain asylum and eventually bring his family - his wife and a three year old boy (almost as old as the civil war in Syria, which broke out in March 2011).
resps: But the trip was a failure. After being arrested at Amsterdam airport and then released, he was arrested again in Belgium for trying to use a false passport. He was imprisoned in Bruges and sentenced to two months in prison.
filtered_resps: But the trip was a failure. After being arrested at Amsterdam airport and then released, he was arrested again in Belgium for trying to use a false passport. He was imprisoned in Bruges and sentenced to two months in prison.
bleu: But the trip was a failure. After being arrested at Amsterdam airport and then released, he was arrested again in Belgium for trying to use a false passport. He was imprisoned in Bruges and sentenced to two months in prison.

Din material mai aflăm că Laith (care-nseamnă leu în arabă) era, într-adevăr, în drum spre Olanda, unde are un văr - fost ofițer superior în armata siriană și devenit apoi și el rebel și ajuns în Occident după ce a fost grav rănit - sperând să obțină azil și să-și poată aduce apoi și familia - soția și un băiețel de trei ani (aproape de-o vârstă cu războiul civil din Siria, care a izbucnit în martie 2011).

translation.en: Once he manages to do this, we can't rule out that Laith Al-Saleh is going to return to Syria to continue fighting for the Syrian Free Army (supported by the West) - against three forces: the army of President Bashar Assad (backed by Russia), the Islamic State and the Nusra Front, an Al-Qaeda affiliate.
translation.ro: După ce va fi reușit acest lucru, Laith Al-Saleh n-ar fi exclus o întoarcere în Siria pentru a continua lupta pentru Armata Liberă Siriană (sprijinită de Occident) - împotriva a trei forțe: armata președintelui Bashar Assad (sprijinită de ruși), a Statului Islamic și a Frontului Nusra, afiliat Al-Qaeda.

target: După ce va fi reușit acest lucru, Laith Al-Saleh n-ar fi exclus o întoarcere în Siria pentru a continua lupta pentru Armata Liberă Siriană (sprijinită de Occident) - împotriva a trei forțe: armata președintelui Bashar Assad (sprijinită de ruși), a Statului Islamic și a Frontului Nusra, afiliat Al-Qaeda.

bleu: După ce va fi reușit acest lucru, Laith Al-Saleh n-ar fi exclus o întoarcere în Siria pentru a continua lupta pentru Armata Liberă Siriană (sprijinită de Occident) - împotriva a trei forțe: armata președintelui Bashar Assad (sprijinită de ruși), a Statului Islamic și a Frontului Nusra, afiliat Al-Qaeda.

translation.en: It's crazy - those who want freedom in Syria must fight against three enemies, not one!
translation.ro: O nebunie - cine vrea libertate trebuie să lupte în Siria împotriva nu a unui singur inamic, ci a trei!

target: O nebunie - cine vrea libertate trebuie să lupte în Siria împotriva nu a unui singur inamic, ci a trei!

translation.en: I also came across a Serbian article from August 22, of which I did not understand much, just that Laith Saleh is associated with terrorists that are mixed among the migrants: "TERORISTI SE KRIJU MEĐU MIGRANTIMA" is the title of a news article from http://www.telegraf.rs/vesti, in which I found a picture of the bearded Al Saleh holding a Syrian flag in his hand and one of him as a refugee wearing that "THANK YOU" shirt.
translation.ro: Am mai dat peste un material sârbesc din 22 august, din care n-am înțeles mare lucru, doar că Laith Al Saleh e asociat cu teroriștii care vin odată cu migranții: TERORISTI SE KRIJU MEĐU MIGRANTIMA sună titlul unei știri de pe http://www.telegraf.rs/vesti, în care sunt alăturate o poză cu Al Saleh cu barbă ținând un steag sirian în mână și aceea de refugiat în care poartă tricoul cu "THANK YOU".

target: Am mai dat peste un material sârbesc din 22 august, din care n-am înțeles mare lucru, doar că Laith Al Saleh e asociat cu teroriștii care vin odată cu migranții: TERORISTI SE KRIJU MEĐU MIGRANTIMA sună titlul unei știri de pe http://www.telegraf.rs/vesti, în care sunt alăturate o poză cu Al Saleh cu barbă ținând un steag sirian în mână și aceea de refugiat în care poartă tricoul cu "THANK YOU".

resps: What I could understand from the article is that those who are associated with the terrorists are trying to reach the West and that they are disguised as refugees. If I translated the article correctly, it is said: "... but the real threat is the terrorists who are mixed among migrants and are trying to hide in the West."

resps: In the meantime, I have also discovered that Laith told me that he had been arrested in the same place (a restaurant in Chișinău) where he was arrested in 2013. Laith told me that he was arrested this time because of the same problem with alcohol, but this time there was nothing else added to the alcohol. But I had also found out earlier that the media in Moldova had reported that Laith had been arrested that time because of the same thing - he had been drunk.

resps: The story of the picture containing the two pictures is a sad one. The little girl, seen in the second picture, is the child of a Syrian refugee. The girl’s mother died when she was a baby. Her father took her to Turkey where he remarried. The woman he married had a son of her own and didn’t want the girl around. She would beat and mistreat the little girl, so the father took her to the beach one day and left her there, alone. It was there that a Turkish family found her and took her in. The young girl, who is now 4 years old, called Aysha, has been living with the Turkish family for more than a year and a half. She was placed in an orphanage last year, after her father and stepmother finally came to claim her, but she eventually returned to the Turkish family, who have now become her legal guardians. The family has been trying to adopt her for more than a year, but have been unable to do so, as the Syrian embassy has not processed the necessary papers. They are now trying to get her Turkish citizenship, so that they can officially adopt her. The fair-skinned girl is seen in the first

translation.en: In Romania, on September 9, Carla Dinu of Hotnews picks up the manipulation story from BBC, although the title is erroneously translated: "A fake photo which has become viral shows an ISIS fighter posing as a refugee".
translation.ro: În România, pe 9 septembrie Carla Dinu de la Hotnews preia povestea cu manipularea de pe BBC, traducând însă greșit titlul: "O fotografie falsa devenita virala arata un luptator ISIS dandu-se drept refugiat".

target: În România, pe 9 septembrie Carla Dinu de la Hotnews preia povestea cu manipularea de pe BBC, traducând însă greșit titlul: "O fotografie falsa devenita virala arata un luptator ISIS dandu-se drept refugiat".
arguments: translate English to Romanian: In Romania, on September 9, Carla Dinu of Hotnews picks up the manipulation story from BBC, although the title is erroneously translated: "A fake photo which has become viral shows an ISIS fighter posing as a refugee".
resps: In the article, she does not say what the image is about, only that it has gone viral and it is fake.

The story does not mention that the photo was taken in Romania, but it does say that the ISIS fighter is a Romanian citizen.
The Romanian media continues to report on the manipulation, sometimes making new mistakes. On September 10, Hotnews publishes a news article written after a press release issued by the Romanian Border Police. The title is: "The Romanian Border Police: The ISIS fighter who was taken in by the Romanians, was a war veteran". The story is inaccurate and contains two manipulations. First, the ISIS fighter is a Romanian citizen, so he is not taken in by the Romanians. Second, he was never a war veteran.
On September 10, the Romanian national television, TVR, publishes an article with the headline: "In Romania, an ISIS fighter who was rejected by the Border Police, was arrested in the subway". The story is inaccurate: the Border Police never rejected this man, because he was not at the border, but in Bucharest.
On September 12, the Romanian news website, G4Media, publishes a video interview with a Romanian

Dinu doesn't mention that it was first picked up by Hotnews, but she does mention that it is a big topic in the international press. In the comments, the Hotnews readers show some scepticism towards the photo: "Look how it's photoshopped", "The photo is fake", "The guy is not ISIS".
bleu: În România, pe 9 septembrie Carla Dinu de la Hotnews preia povestea cu manipularea de pe BBC, traducând însă greșit titlul: "O fotografie falsa devenita virala arata un luptator ISIS dandu-se drept refugiat".

translation.en: Obviously, the picture is not a fake, but the interpretation was false, wrong, in short: manipulative.
translation.ro: Evident, nu fotografia e falsă, ci interpretarea a fost una falsă, greșită, pe scurt: manipulatorie.

target: Evident, nu fotografia e falsă, ci interpretarea a fost una falsă, greșită, pe scurt: manipulatorie.

bleu: Evident, nu fotografia e falsă, ci interpretarea a fost una falsă, greșită, pe scurt: manipulatorie.

translation.en: The champion of the Iasi Rally, Simone Tempestini secured the national rally title, becoming the youngest winner in championship history
translation.ro: Învingător în Raliul Iașului, Simone Tempestini și-a asigurat titlul național la raliuri, devenind cel mai tânăr laureat din istoria campionatului

target: Învingător în Raliul Iașului, Simone Tempestini și-a asigurat titlul național la raliuri, devenind cel mai tânăr laureat din istoria campionatului
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The champion of the Iasi Rally, Simone Tempestini secured the national rally title, becoming the youngest winner in championship history
bleu: Învingător în Raliul Iașului, Simone Tempestini și-a asigurat titlul național la raliuri, devenind cel mai tânăr laureat din istoria campionatului

translation.en: The Cotnari Iasi Rally 2015 ended with a fabulous result for young pilot Simone Tempestini, an Italian with Romanian citizenship, which at 21 has won all nine races of the most difficult stages of the National Rally Championship.
translation.ro: Raliul Iasului Cotnari 2015 s-a încheiat cu un rezultat fabulor al tânărului pilot Simone Tempestini, italian cu cetățenie română, care la 21 de ani a câștigat toate cele nouă probe speciale ale celei mai dificile etape din Campionatul Național de Raliuri.

target: Raliul Iasului Cotnari 2015 s-a încheiat cu un rezultat fabulor al tânărului pilot Simone Tempestini, italian cu cetățenie română, care la 21 de ani a câștigat toate cele nouă probe speciale ale celei mai dificile etape din Campionatul Național de Raliuri.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The Cotnari Iasi Rally 2015 ended with a fabulous result for young pilot Simone Tempestini, an Italian with Romanian citizenship, which at 21 has won all nine races of the most difficult stages of the National Rally Championship.
resps: On Saturday, the young driver won the first special stage, the second was won by the Turkish driver Erhan Jajinoz, and the third stage by Dan Nistor, but the fourth stage was the one that brought the success to Tempestini. The Rally Cotnari Iasi ended on Sunday evening with the victory of Simone Tempestini and co-driver Giovanni Bernacchini, followed by Dan Nistor and co-driver Sorin Vatamanu, on the second place, and on the third place the Turkish driver Erhan Jajinoz and co-driver Burcin Korkmaz. In the fourth position was the driver Bogdan Marisca and co-driver Radu Banciu. The Cotnari Iasi Rally was the third round of the National Rally Championship, but also the third victory for Simone Tempestini and Giovanni Bernacchini.</s>
bleu: Raliul Iasului Cotnari 2015 s-a încheiat cu un rezultat fabulor al tânărului pilot Simone Tempestini, italian cu cetățenie română, care la 21 de ani a câștigat toate cele nouă probe speciale ale celei mai dificile etape din Campionatul Național de Raliuri.

translation.en: Leader in the competition so far, Simone became the national champion a race before the final, driving a Ford Fiesta R5 alongside co-driver Dorin Pulpea.
translation.ro: Fiind și până acum lider în competiție, Simone a devenit cu o etapă înainte de final, campion național, avându-l alături pe copilotul Dorin Pulpea pe un Ford Fiesta R5.

target: Fiind și până acum lider în competiție, Simone a devenit cu o etapă înainte de final, campion național, avându-l alături pe copilotul Dorin Pulpea pe un Ford Fiesta R5.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Leader in the competition so far, Simone became the national champion a race before the final, driving a Ford Fiesta R5 alongside co-driver Dorin Pulpea.
resps: In the final, the pair was again the best in the show, winning the race and the Romanian Rally Championship title.</s>
bleu: Fiind și până acum lider în competiție, Simone a devenit cu o etapă înainte de final, campion național, avându-l alături pe copilotul Dorin Pulpea pe un Ford Fiesta R5.

translation.en: Tempestini became the youngest Romanian rally champion. The previous record holder was Valentin Porcișteanu in 2011 (28 and nine months old).
translation.ro: Tempestini juniori a devenit cel mai tânăr campion român de raliuri, precedentul recordman, din 2011, aparținând lui Valentin Porcișteanu (28 de ani și nouă luni).

target: Tempestini juniori a devenit cel mai tânăr campion român de raliuri, precedentul recordman, din 2011, aparținând lui Valentin Porcișteanu (28 de ani și nouă luni).

translation.en: In the seven stages of the Dunlop National Rally Championship, Simone won 47 special races and his performance in Iasi managed to equal the previous one from the Rally of Arad.
translation.ro: În cele șapte etape ale Campionatului Național de Raliuri Dunlop, Simone a câștigat 47 de probe speciale, iar performanța de la Iași reeditează pe cea precedentă, din Raliul Aradului.

target: În cele șapte etape ale Campionatului Național de Raliuri Dunlop, Simone a câștigat 47 de probe speciale, iar performanța de la Iași reeditează pe cea precedentă, din Raliul Aradului.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: In the seven stages of the Dunlop National Rally Championship, Simone won 47 special races and his performance in Iasi managed to equal the previous one from the Rally of Arad.
resps: He is the only one who has managed to win more than 40 special races in one season and the only one who has managed to win the same number of special races in two different stages of the championship.
The driver from Lugoj, who is the current leader in the Romanian Rally Championship, was followed by the Romanian and the driver of the Skoda Fabia R5, Florin Tincescu.

The Hungarian team composed by Gergö Szabo - Karoly Borbely occupied the third position driving a Mitsubishi Lancer Evo IXO, performance that ranks them in the second position of the overall standings.

arguments: translate English to Romanian: In Class III, the winner was Edwin Keleti, followed by Manuel Mihalache and Dan Gârtofan and the two-wheel drive category was won by Adrian Răspopa.
bleu: La clasa III, a câștigat Edwin Keleti, urmat de Manuel Mihalache și Dan Gârtofan, iar la categoria două roți motrice a câștigat Adrian Răspopa.

translation.en: Other winners were Adrian Dragan (Dacia Cup) and Vlad Cosma (Suzuki Cup).
translation.ro: Alți câștigători au fost Adrian Drăgan (Cupa Dacia) și Vlad Cosma (Cupa Suzuki).

target: Alți câștigători au fost Adrian Drăgan (Cupa Dacia) și Vlad Cosma (Cupa Suzuki).
arguments: translate English to Romanian: Other winners were Adrian Dragan (Dacia Cup) and Vlad Cosma (Suzuki Cup).
bleu: Alți câștigători au fost Adrian Drăgan (Cupa Dacia) și Vlad Cosma (Cupa Suzuki).

translation.en: The crew from Iasi composed by Dan Iamandi - Răzvan Subțirelu abandoned the race during the eighth race.
translation.ro: Echipajul ieșean Dan Iamandi - Răzvan Subțirelu a abandonat în timpul specialei a opta.

target: Echipajul ieșean Dan Iamandi - Răzvan Subțirelu a abandonat în timpul specialei a opta.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The crew from Iasi composed by Dan Iamandi - Răzvan Subțirelu abandoned the race during the eighth race.
resps: The translation is: Echipajul din Iasi compus din Dan Iamandi - Răzvan Subțirelu a abandonat cursa în timpul celui de-al optulea tur.
bleu: Echipajul ieșean Dan Iamandi - Răzvan Subțirelu a abandonat în timpul specialei a opta.

translation.en: We went through the whole range of emotions during this period.
translation.ro: Am trecut prin toată gama de trăiri în această perioadă.

target: Am trecut prin toată gama de trăiri în această perioadă.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: We went through the whole range of emotions during this period.
bleu: Am trecut prin toată gama de trăiri în această perioadă.

translation.en: "The positive reaction of pilots and Federation officials makes me hope that this year we will be organizing champions again", said rally manager, Dan Codreanu.
translation.ro: "Reacția pozitivă a piloților și oficialilor Federației mă face să sper că vom fi și în acest an campion la organizare", a spus managerul raliului, Dan Codreanu.

target: "Reacția pozitivă a piloților și oficialilor Federației mă face să sper că vom fi și în acest an campion la organizare", a spus managerul raliului, Dan Codreanu.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: "The positive reaction of pilots and Federation officials makes me hope that this year we will be organizing champions again", said rally manager, Dan Codreanu.
resps: The announcement was made during an event that took place in the center of Bucharest, on the occasion of the 100 days before the start of the race.
bleu: "Reacția pozitivă a piloților și oficialilor Federației mă face să sper că vom fi și în acest an campion la organizare", a spus managerul raliului, Dan Codreanu.

translation.en: The Cotnari Iasi Rally was organized by XS Motorsport (manager, Dan Codreanu) in partnership with Cotnari, Iasi City Hall, Hotel International, Ford Iasi - ATI Motors Holding, supported by the Iasi Forestry Department, the County Gendarmerie Inspectorate, the Inspectorate for Emergency Situations, the Ambulance Service, the County Council and the Iasi Prefecture.
translation.ro: Raliul Iașului Cotnari a fost organizat de XS Motorsport (manager, Dan Codreanu) în parteneriat cu Compania Cotnari, Primaria Municipiului Iași, Hotel Internațional, Ford Iași - ATI Motors Holding, cu sprijinul Direcției Silvice Iași, Inspectoratul Județean de Politie, Inspectoratul Județean de Jandarmi, Inspectoratul pentru Situații de Urgență, Serviciul de Ambulanță Consiliul Județean și, Prefectura Județului Iași.

target: Raliul Iașului Cotnari a fost organizat de XS Motorsport (manager, Dan Codreanu) în parteneriat cu Compania Cotnari, Primaria Municipiului Iași, Hotel Internațional, Ford Iași - ATI Motors Holding, cu sprijinul Direcției Silvice Iași, Inspectoratul Județean de Politie, Inspectoratul Județean de Jandarmi, Inspectoratul pentru Situații de Urgență, Serviciul de Ambulanță Consiliul Județean și, Prefectura Județului Iași.
arguments: translate English to Romanian: The Cotnari Iasi Rally was organized by XS Motorsport (manager, Dan Codreanu) in partnership with Cotnari, Iasi City Hall, Hotel International, Ford Iasi - ATI Motors Holding, supported by the Iasi Forestry Department, the County Gendarmerie Inspectorate, the Inspectorate for Emergency Situations, the Ambulance Service, the County Council and the Iasi Prefecture.
resps: The event was attended by 38 crews (33 in the speed competition, 5 in the regularity competition), from Romania, Moldova and Hungary. The course of the rally was 180 km, of which 90 km of special stages. The Cotnari Iasi Rally 2009 was won in the speed competition by the Romanian crew formed by Bogdan Marisca and Andrei Muresan, driving a Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution IX, and in the regularity competition by the mixed crew consisting of the Romanian Paul Dan Nicolae and the Moldavian Ilie Bivol, driving a BMW 325.

bleu: The event was attended by 38 crews (33 in the speed competition, 5 in the regularity competition), from Romania, Moldova and Hungary. The course of the rally was 180 km, of which 90 km of special stages. The Cotnari Iasi Rally 2009 was won in the speed competition by the Romanian crew formed by Bogdan Marisca and Andrei Muresan, driving a Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution IX, and in the regularity competition by the mixed crew consisting of the Romanian Paul Dan Nicolae and the Moldavian Ilie Bivol, driving a BMW 325.

Raliul Iașului Cotnari a fost organizat de XS Motorsport (manager, Dan Codreanu) în parteneriat cu Compania Cotnari, Primaria Municipiului Iași, Hotel Internațional, Ford Iași - ATI Motors Holding, cu sprijinul Direcției Silvice Iași, Inspectoratul Județean de Politie, Inspectoratul Județean de Jandarmi, Inspectoratul pentru Situații de Urgență, Serviciul de Ambulanță Consiliul Județean și, Prefectura Județului Iași.
